races.title: Landing Page Sprint
races.goal: Build a landing page headline section that converts
races.startingPoint: You have a SaaS tool for scheduling social media posts

milestones.task: Write the main headline
Add subheadline with specific benefit
Add social proof (user count + statistic)
Add CTA button with urgency

races.winCondition: All 4 elements complete, plus at least one includes specific number/metric
races.tips: Use AIDA framework. Lead with benefit, not feature. Include proof. Make CTA action-oriented.

races.title: Email Copy Championship
races.goal: Write an email that gets clicks
races.startingPoint: You're announcing a new feature to existing users

milestones.task: Write subject line with curiosity/urgency
Write email body that answers: What is it? Why should I care?
Add specific benefit statement (saves X time, earns $Y)
Add CTA with single, clear action

races.winCondition: Subject line under 50 chars, body under 150 words, includes 1 metric, CTA is obvious
races.tips: Subject lines that work: curiosity, urgency, specificity, or benefit. Keep email scannable with short sentences.

races.title: Product Description Dash
races.goal: Write complete product description for an e-commerce item

milestones.task: Write headline emphasizing #1 benefit (not feature)
Write 2-3 sentence benefit section
List 3-5 key features with benefits (not just specs)
Add social proof + CTA (Buy Now or Add to Cart)

races.winCondition: Benefits before features, includes proof (reviews/ratings/users), CTA is prominent
races.tips: Features = what it has. Benefits = what it DOES for you. Always lead with benefit. Proof kills doubt.

races.title: Social Media Content Blitz
races.goal: Create 5 social posts for a coffee brand in 5 minutes
races.startingPoint: You need posts for Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Pinterest

milestones.task: Instagram post (visual description + caption with emoji)
TikTok trend-based post idea (in-the-moment, casual)
LinkedIn thought leadership post (professional, insightful)
Twitter hot take or stat about coffee culture
Pinterest pin copy (inspirational, SEO-friendly)

races.winCondition: All 5 complete, each fits platform tone, at least 3 include CTAs or engagement hooks
races.tips: Each platform has a different tone. Instagram = lifestyle. TikTok = authentic. LinkedIn = insights. Twitter = hot takes. Pinterest = inspiration.

races.title: Sales Page Power Run
races.goal: Build a complete sales page structure
races.startingPoint: You're selling an online course on freelance pricing

milestones.task: Hero section (headline + subheader + CTA)
Problem/Solution section (what's wrong, how you fix it)
Features/Benefits section (what they get, why it matters)
Social proof section (testimonials, stats, results)
Final CTA section with objection handling + urgency

races.winCondition: All sections complete, includes metrics, at least 2 objections addressed, CTA in multiple places
races.tips: Sales page formula: Pain → Awareness of solution → How it works → Proof → Remove doubts → Ask for sale. Repeat CTA.

races.title: Ad Copy Velocity
races.goal: Write ad copy variations that increase CTR
races.startingPoint: You're running ads for a project management tool

milestones.task: Write Ad Copy A: Benefit-driven angle
Write Ad Copy B: FOMO/Urgency angle
Write Ad Copy C: Social proof angle
Write Ad Copy D: Free trial/low commitment angle

races.winCondition: 4 variations complete, each under 60 characters for headline, each uses different psychology trigger
races.tips: A/B testing wins when you change ONE variable at a time. Different angles: benefit, urgency, proof, low-barrier entry.

races.title: Content Outline Sprint
races.goal: Create detailed outline for blog post that ranks
races.startingPoint: Write outline for: 'How to Negotiate Your First Freelance Project'

milestones.task: Hook/Intro (why people care, what they'll learn)
Main sections (3-5 key concepts with subpoints)
Add data points / stats to research for each section
CTA + resource section (checklist, template, tool recommendations)

races.winCondition: Includes 1-2 stats to verify, main sections have actionable subpoints, has downloadable resource
races.tips: Good outlines: hook readers immediately, break complex topics into digestible chunks, include data, and provide actionable takeaway.

races.title: Marketing Campaign Blitz
races.goal: Design complete marketing campaign for product launch
races.startingPoint: You're launching a new AI tool for managing team workflows

milestones.task: Positioning statement (who, what, why, unique angle)
Launch email sequence plan (3 emails, each with purpose)
Social media content calendar (7 days of posts)
Press release or PR angle + influencer pitch approach
Measure success framework (what metrics = success?)

races.winCondition: All parts complete, campaign is cohesive (same messaging), includes both awareness + conversion tactics, metrics aligned to business goal
races.tips: Best campaigns use multiple channels but one core message. Position once, repeat everywhere. Measure everything.

races.title: Rebrand the Company
races.goal: Create complete brand messaging for a rebrand
races.startingPoint: Tech consultancy 'TechSolutions Inc' rebranding to appeal to Gen-Z startups

milestones.task: New brand name ideas + tagline options (at least 3)
Brand voice/tone guide (how they talk, what they value)
Value proposition + mission statement
Website homepage copy (hero + value sections)
Brand launch announcement + press materials

races.winCondition: New brand is coherent (name/tagline/voice all align), appeals to target (Gen-Z startups), messaging is consistent across all materials
races.tips: Strong rebrands: pick ONE strategic shift (were boring, now cool) and execute that everywhere. Consistency beats perfection.

races.title: The Ultimate Race
races.goal: Prove you're a copy ninja: Quick prompt, quick output, high quality
races.startingPoint: Write the BEST headline for a new AI coding tool (60 seconds)
races.challenge: Your headline must include: (1) Specific benefit, (2) Create curiosity or urgency, (3) Use power word, (4) Be under 10 words
races.winCondition: Headline meets all 4 criteria and is genuinely compelling
races.tips: Best headlines: Show benefit (why should I care?), create intrigue or urgency (why now?), use power words (best, guaranteed, finally, secret), keep it short (under 10 words).
races.examples:
❌ 'New coding AI tool' (no benefit, no urgency, boring)
✅ 'Finally, the AI that actually writes YOUR code (not templates)' (benefit, urgency, proof angle, power word)
